intro: Peperomia lilifolia, commonly known as the laceleaf peperomia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its delicate, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–15 inches and prefers bright, indirect light. Its compact growth habit makes it an ideal choice for indoor gardening. Peperomia lilifolia is relatively low-maintenance, requiring well-draining soil and moderate watering.
